metadata.title: CVE-2023-0137 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in Platform Apps in Google Chrome on Chrome OS priorto 109.0.5414.74 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to potentially exploit heap corruption via a craftedHTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-browser-l10n - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-chromedriver - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
